results.title: Babbit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Great American novel”.
Discusses the parallels between American middle class society as it is today to that of forty years ago as depicted in the novels “Babbitt”, by Sinclair Lewis and “Grapes of Wrath” by John Steinbeck.

results.title: Gods and men
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
Famous British archaeologist Sir Mortimer Wheeler introduces the story of Christian influence on the degraded Roman Empire, with its cynical worship of gods. A message and belief was brought to spiritually empty Rome.

results.title: Skeleton of an empire
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
Sir Mortimer Wheeler surveys the remains of the Roman Empire and examines its great length and breadth, from Hadrian’s Wall in northern England to the southern perimeter in the Sahara, from Merida in Spain eastwards to Jerash in Jordan.

results.title: Roman art and architecture
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
A discussion of ancient Rome’s art and architecture, particularly of functional constructions such as aqueducts, and of domes and large interiors.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.

results.title: Safe on the road
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The number of road accidents resulting in death or severe injuries is increasing. Statistics of road accidents are given and the film stresses the need for responsible attitudes by all road users. The necessity for using all available safety precautions is emphasised.
results.description:

results.title: Love now pay later
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
An introductory description of the increasing incidence of venereal disease. A consultant surgeon of a London VD Clinic explains the range of causative factors.

results.title: In a cleaner greener land
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
This film deals with the enormous problems of pollution of the air, the water and the land. All three are dealt with in detail but the pollution of the air is given greater attention in this timely film.

Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
